legal_citations: ACAS Code of Practice on Disciplinary and Grievance Procedures

sections.heading: 1. PURPOSE
sections.text:
1.1 This procedure provides a fair and effective method for employees to raise concerns about their work, working environment, or relationships with colleagues.

1.2 It applies to all employees of [EMPLOYER_NAME].

1.3 This procedure complies with the ACAS Code of Practice.

sections.heading: 2. INFORMAL RESOLUTION
sections.text:
2.1 Most grievances can be resolved informally by speaking with your line manager.

2.2 If informal resolution is not possible or appropriate, use the formal procedure below.

sections.heading: 3. FORMAL GRIEVANCE
sections.text:
3.1 Submit your grievance in writing to [GRIEVANCE_CONTACT], stating:
- The nature of your grievance
- Supporting facts and evidence
- How you would like it resolved

3.2 Grievances should be raised promptly while the matter is still fresh.

3.3 We will acknowledge your grievance within [ACK_DAYS] working days and arrange a meeting normally within [MEETING_DAYS] working days.

sections.heading: 4. GRIEVANCE MEETING
sections.text:
4.1 You will be invited to a meeting to discuss your grievance.

4.2 You have the right to be accompanied by a work colleague or trade union representative.

4.3 The meeting will be conducted by a manager who is not the subject of the grievance.

4.4 We may adjourn to investigate your concerns.

4.5 We will provide a written response within [RESPONSE_DAYS] working days, including:
- Our findings
- Any action we will take  
- Your right to appeal

sections.heading: 5. APPEAL
sections.text:
5.1 If you are not satisfied with the outcome, you may appeal in writing to [APPEAL_CONTACT] within [APPEAL_DAYS] working days.

5.2 An appeal meeting will be arranged with a more senior manager.

5.3 The appeal decision is final.
